topic.title: Introduction
topic.shortdesc: This section serves to lead users through the key principles of Knowledge Base.

body.p: This portal was developed based on the analysis on the content needs within the company and designed to align company stated goals. Company goals, content requirements and the portal organization principles are described in the PDF report Current Content State: Part 1 (report may be provided on demand).

p.note: To understand each menu bar sections' purpose, select the Finshape Knowledge Base at the top left corner, afterwards scroll down, and explore each section's and subsection's short description.

Knowledge Base comprises of following main Entities: Role, Right, Workspace, Use case (Task), Step, Data object, Connector, Data source. To make Knowledge Base content reusable, we should make changes within the Entity pages.

section.title: Knowledge Base strategy
section.p:
One of the company current goals is reducing Project implementation time and cost. There are four main bottleneck in achieving this result:
Initial proposition issue. Sometimes Salesperson offers to client company possibilities instead of its real products. See also .
Integration issue. API integrators face to variety of core banking systems.
Translation issue. Front-end developers get Technical assignment for developing apps and don't understand how to make it using tools they have.
Data matching issue. Front-end developers don't know what data should be connected to specific use-case UI controls.

Knowledge Base from the strategic point of view must twice reduce wasting time for searching information by humans and provide structured information objects for AI agent to give it possibilities to work with. That's why it must become a tool for providing company's employees, partners, and clients with the information necessary to handle specific use-cases tasks.
Portal technology must allow to generate, update and handle Role specific (Potential customers, bank clients, bank employee Roles, Finshape Roles etc.) static UI pages.

Information must be provided in a convenient format (inside app, web, PDF, Word, etc.), on all platforms (desk, tablet, mobile) and in a timely manner. That means not in the form of a narrative book that no one intends or will read, but in the form of a specific, step-by-step task completion guidance.

Usually, users are looking for instruction on how to, rather than general information. A use case can be on any topic and depends on the role the portal user currently plays. Potential customers, bank employees, and bank clients handle Functional tasks, Finshape employees and partners Product tasks.
